questions.question:
One million electrons travel between two points in a circuit.
The total energy gained by the electrons is 1.6x10<sup>-10</sup>J.

What is the potential difference between the two points?
Which is not a unit of energy?

A progressive wave of amplitude a has intensity I. This wave combines with another wave of amplitude 0.6 a at a point in space. The phase difference between the waves is 180°. What is the resultant intensity of the combined waves in terms of I

Stationary waves are produced in a tube closed at one end and open at the other end. The fundamental frequency is 120 Hz.

What is a possible frequency for a harmonic for this tube?

A capacitor discharges through a resistor. At time t = 0, the charge stored by the capacitor is 600 μC. The capacitor loses 5.0 % of its charge every second.

What is the charge left on the capacitor at time t = 4.0 s?
Which statement is correct?
answers: Hadrons are made up of protons and neutrons.
A positron and a proton are examples of leptons.
The positron and the electron have the same mass.
The weak nuclear force is responsible for alpha decay.

questions.question:
An electron moves in a circle of radius 2.0 cm in a uniform magnetic field of flux density 170 mT.

What is the momentum of this electron?
A beam of charged particles is not deflected when it passes through a region where both electric and magnetic fields are present. Which statement is not correct?
answers: All the particles have the same speed.
The resultant force on each particle is zero.
The magnetic force is equal to the electric force on each particle.
The magnetic field and the electric field are in the same direction.

questions.question:
There are four important attenuation mechanisms by which X-ray photons may interact when they pass through matter.

In which mechanism is the X-ray photon scattered with a longer wavelength?
Which of these statements are true about X-Rays? A) They are affected by a magnetic field B) They are electromagnetic waves C) They are used in CAT scans
answers: A, B and C are correct
Only B and C are correct

questions.question:
An ultrasound transducer emits ultrasound towards a baby at 20kHz.
The detector detects pulses at t=30μs and t=85μs.

The speed of ultrasound in the head is 1.5x10<sup>3</sup> m s<sup>-1</sup>

 What is the size of the head?
